coordinate_request_dialog.title: Request Coordinate
coordinate_request_dialog.text: Request a Coordinate that's not in the database yet

content_items.question: What's the difference between the map explorer and the world trait finder?
content_items.answer: The map explorer is where you can browse maps that contributors have submitted. These maps contain detailed information on geysers, POIs, etc. The world trait finder contains limited information on every seed that can exist, even if a contributor hasn't submitted it yet. Once you find some seeds you like, you can request them and they will be viewable within the map explorer once the requests have been filled.

content_items.question: How do I search for a specific map/seed?
content_items.answer: While there currently isn't a place within the UI to do this, you can append a map to the end of the map explorer URL. For example, mapsnotincluded.org/map-explorer/SNDST-A-1-0-0-0 would search for the seed SNDST-A-1-0-0-0.

content_items.question: How do I search for a map with specific mixing settings?
content_items.answer: Using the map explorer, you can either search for specific DLC biomes, or enter a mixing preset (using the "Mixing: -/-" field). The easiest way of getting the mixing preset you want is by going to the world trait finder, configuring your mixing settings and copying the last section from the example seed. It should look something like "E6A87".

content_items.question: How do I save/share my map explorer search queries?
content_items.answer: Next to the reset and search buttons, there is a clipboard button allowing you to copy the link to your search query. When this link is pasted into your browser, it will automatically apply the filter settings associated with that link.

content_items.question: What does requesting a map do?
content_items.answer: When you request a map, it's added to the request queue. Once the request is filled by a contributor, it will be available to view in the map explorer. Maps added to the queue first are last to be filled, which means that you can request as many maps as you want without clogging the queue for days.

content_items.question: How does DLC mixing affect geysers?
content_items.answer: Biomes which haven't been replaced via mixing will keep their geysers. However, biomes which have been replaced will have their geysers deleted, with new ones generating across the map.

content_items.question: Can I contribute maps with specific mixing settings?
content_items.answer: At the moment, there is no way to contribute maps with specific mixing settings. The closest you can get is turning mixing frequency up to 100% and enabling/disabling DLCs with content you do/don't want to mix.

content_items.solution: Your leaderboard position only updates once per day, when the database updates.

content_items.problem: Mod can't establish a connection to the server
content_items.solution: This is most likely due to a back-end error, which could be a multitude of things. Status updates on this are usually posted in the {discordLink}.

description.developer: This project is open source and contributions are welcome. If you have a feature request or found a bug, please open an issue on the GitHub repository. If you would like to contribute code, please fork the repository and submit a pull request. You can find us at {githubLink}
description.gamer:
Please donate your compute power and upload saves to make this tool better for everyone.

To do this, please follow the instructions below.

1. Locate your ONI mod folder. It is usually in C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\Klei\OxygenNotIncluded\mods.
2. Go into or create a folder named "Local" (case sensitive on linux).
3. Download and unzip the latest mod build from the {githubReleaseLink}.
4. Put the files in the local folder.
5. Start Oxygen Not Included and enable the mod. It won't work if there are any other mods enabled. You may also need to disable default save to cloud in Oxygen Not Included settings.

Additionally we're looking for feedback on the site, if you have any suggestions or found a bug, please come and share your thoughts on {discordLink}.

And finally, if you know anything about the world generation process in Oxygen Not Included, we would love to hear from you. We're always looking to improve our understanding of the game and the tools we build around it.
description.artist: We're looking for some graphics for the site, if you have any ideas or would like to contribute, please get in touch.
description.donation: MapsNotIncluded is the work of multiple people. If you would like to support our work with money you can donate to {donateHosting}, the {donateSeedBrowser} and the {donateMod}.

contributor.introduction: Huge thank you to the following people who have contributed to the project, either directly or indirectly (through works that have aided the ideas or development of the project).
contributor.item_1: {RoboPhred} - Thank you for your contributions to parsing and understanding ONI saves
contributor.item_2: {StefanOltmann} - Thank you for the web interface to parse ONI saves that was made fully open source
contributor.item_3: {Sgt_lmalas} - Thank you for building an awesome world generation mod, which largely inspired our first version, until you made changes specifically for us, hope we can keep annoying you for more for a long time!
contributor.item_4: {Cairath} - Thank you for giving the community such a wonderful tool for years and years with no expectation of payment. We hope one day to collaborate directly together! Also thank you for your administration of the Discord server and for the guides written for modding ONI!
contributor.item_5: {paradeike} creator of {harmony}, the library that made modding ONI possible.
contributor.item_6: {Magnet_MD} For the inspiration for this project, I (LeCoffee) personally would have never discovered the importance of seed finding without watching content creators such as Magnet
contributor.item_7: {Klei} - Thank you for creating such a wonderful game and for the community you have fostered around it

description.contact: If you would like to contact us directly and more formally, please email us at {email}

link.donate_hosting: the guy who runs the servers
link.donate_seed_browser: the guy who built the map explorer
link.donate_mod: the guy who developed the mod we are using

home.title: Welcome to MapsNotIncluded!
home.description_1: This is the home of the fully open source TNI replacement.
home.description_2: Want to get involved? Head over to our {contributeLink} page. You can also join our community on {discordLink} or submit issues and pull requests via {githubLink}!

not_found.title: 404 Not Found
not_found.description_1: Sorry, the page you are looking for does not exist.
not_found.description_2: If you reached this page by clicking around, the chances are it hasn't been built yet, if your technically minded, please use our {githubLink} link to contribute, otherwise come and nag us on our {discordLink}.

seed_viewer.title: Seed Viewer
seed_viewer.description_1: Input a seed to view to explore its map generation. If its not in our database yet, you can request it when logged in.

starmap_generator.title: Starmap Generator
starmap_generator.description_1: A starmap generator will be available here once development is complete.
starmap_generator.description_2: If you'd like to get involved, feel free to {contribute} to the development of this site.
